document.heading: Rental Housing Source of Income Amendment Act of 2020

To amend the Housing Act of 2002 to clarify that rental housing assistance provided by the District government shall be considered the income of the tenant for the purposes of any minimum income qualification for a rental unit and for the purposes of the Human Rights Act of 1977, to prohibit the owner of a housing accommodation from refusing to rent a rental unit to a person because the person will provide the rental payment through a voucher for rental housing assistance provided by the District or federal government, and to require the owner of a housing accommodation to clearly state in any written notice, statement, or advertisement for a rental unit that the housing provider will not refuse to rent a rental unit to a person because the person will provide the rental payment through a voucher for rental housing assistance.

history.summary: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced, Bill 23-528 establishes that rental housing assistance provided by the District government to an owner of a housing accommodation shall be considered the income of the tenant for the purposes of any minimum income qualification for rental of a dwelling unit. Among other things it prohibits owners from denying housing to a person because the person's payment is in whole or in part through a voucher for rental housing assistance.

document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Rental Housing Source of Income Amendment Act of 2020".

section.text: Section 206 of the Housing Act of 2002, effective April 19, 2002 (D.C. Law 14-114; D.C. Official Code ยง 42-2851.06), is amended as follows:

para.text: The section heading is amended to read as follows:

codify:find-replace.find: Section 8 assistance considered income for non-discrimination and minimum income purposes; requirement to accept section 8 vouchers.

para.text: Subsection (a) is amended by striking the phrase "Act of 1937," and inserting the phrase "Act of 1937 or any District law or program authorizing the payment of rental housing assistance," in its place.

codify:find-replace.replace: Act of 1937 or any District law or program authorizing the payment of rental housing assistance,

para.text: Subsection (b) is amended by striking the phrase "Act of 1937," and inserting the phrase "Act of 1937 or any District law or program authorizing the payment of rental housing assistance," in its place.

codify:find-replace.replace: Act of 1937 or any District law or program authorizing the payment of rental housing assistance,

para.text: Subsection (c) is amended by striking the phrase "section 8 voucher." and inserting the phrase "voucher for rental housing assistance provided by the District or federal government." in its place.

codify:find-replace.replace: voucher for rental housing assistance provided by the District or federal government.

para.text: A new subsection (d) is added to read as follows:

In any written notice, statement, or advertisement of a dwelling unit for rent, the housing provider shall clearly state that the housing provider will not refuse to rent a rental unit to a person because the person will provide the rental payment, in whole or in part, through a voucher for rental housing assistance provided by the District or federal government.

section.heading: Fiscal impact statement.
section.text: The Council adopts the fiscal impact statement in the committee report as the fiscal impact statement required by section 4a of the General Legislative Procedures Act of 1975, approved October 16, 2006 (12 Stat. 2038; D.C. Official Code ยง 1-301.47a).

section.heading: Effective date.
section.text: This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto), a 30-day period of congressional review as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C. Official Code ยง 1-206.02(c)(1)), and publication in the District of Columbia Register.
